TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is ORG ( ORG ) , a public law foundation ( PERSON ) with its seat in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant broadcast information on the evening news of its regional television channel about the release on parole of PERSON , head of a neo - NORP organisation called LAW to ORG – “ VAPO ” ) who had been sentenced under LAW ( GPE , “ the LAW ” ) . This news item also mentioned his deputy PERSON , who had been convicted under LAW in DATE and had been released on parole DATE . Its text ran as follows :

“ For PERSON [ full name ] was known as the head of the NORP neo - NORP scene . But it was only after the strengthening of LAW in DATE that he was charged and sentenced to DATE imprisonment . Many other members of the ORG were put behind bars along with him , among them PERSON name ] – who has also recently been released . K.[family name ] , now aged DATE , made the headlines even while in prison in GPE , for instance at the first letter bomb trial . His release DATE , however , took place without much ado . Waiting journalists saw nothing but his belongings packed in boxes . ”
CARDINAL . While the third sentence of this text was broadcast , a picture showing PERSON at his trial in DATE was broadcast for TIME .

CARDINAL . The news item was followed by a brief statement of the commentator . He stated that PERSON had served DATE of his sentence . ORG had opposed his release on parole , but ORG had granted PERSON 's request , having refused his first request for early release in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE S. brought proceedings under LAW ) , requesting that the applicant be prohibited from publishing his picture without his consent accompanied by any text stating that he had been convicted LAW once the sentence had been executed or once he had been released on parole . In addition he requested a preliminary injunction to that effect .

CARDINAL . In its submissions in reply ( PERSON ) the applicant asserted that it had reported on true facts . As regards the publication of the applicant 's picture the applicant referred to ORG established case - law that LAW had to be interpreted in the light of LAW of LAW ( see below ) . Given that PERSON was an adult who had been convicted of a crime , it followed from LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW that the publication of his picture only violated his legitimate interests if it substantially prejudiced his economic advancement . Even if the claimant 's legitimate interests were affected , they had to be weighed against the public interest in the publication . In the present case , the public interest was predominant , given that ORG was an organisation which aimed at destroying the NORP constitutional order and that CARDINAL of its leading members , namely PERSON and the claimant , had been released from prison within a short period . Other media including CARDINAL leading DATE newspapers had also mentioned PERSON 's release in the context of reports on PERSON 's release . Finally , the applicant emphasised that under the relevant broadcasting laws it even had an obligation to impart information on political issues .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ORG ) granted the preliminary injunction .

CARDINAL . ORG noted that the following facts were undisputed : The claimant , who had been convicted under LAW in DATE and had been sentenced to DATE imprisonment , had been one of the leading members of ORG which aimed at fighting against democratic order in GPE . He had participated in training camps organised by ORG which were destined to train to kill . He had been released on DATE and PERSON DATE on DATE . On the latter date the applicant had broadcast the report at issue .

CARDINAL . As to the interpretation of Section CARDINAL of LAW in conjunction with LAW of LAW , the ORG agreed that the legitimate interests of an adult who had been convicted of a crime were only violated if the publication of his name or picture disproportionately prejudiced his economic advancement .

CARDINAL . Applying this case - law to the facts of the present case , ORG noted that the report in the present case dealt mainly with PERSON 's release on parole . In its view there was an evident interest of S. not to have broadcast his picture taken in the course of criminal proceedings dating DATE back , even if the fact that he had meanwhile been released on parole was mentioned . S. 's picture had been widely broadcast at the time of the criminal proceedings against him . However , its broadcasting at the present stage did not add any relevant information to the report at issue , even if the criminal proceedings against him had been among the most important ones conducted under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) dismissed the applicant 's appeal .

ORG confirmed ORG assessment that the publication of PERSON 's picture had violated his legitimate interests within the meaning of Section CARDINAL of LAW read in conjunction with LAW of LAW . Like ORG it stressed in particular that PERSON 's picture had been broadcast in the context of a report on the release of another person , PERSON , and found that PERSON had an evident interest not to have his picture published in that context even if his own release dating DATE back had also been mentioned . Even taking into account that PERSON had a certain degree of notoriety , his advancement within the meaning of LAW of LAW had been hampered disproportionately by the new publication of a picture taken at his trial .
CARDINAL . ORG ( Oberster Gerichtshof ) rejected the applicant 's extraordinary appeal on points of law on DATE .

In the subsequent main proceedings , ORG gave judgment on DATE . It ordered the applicant to refrain from publishing PERSON 's picture without his consent if it was accompanied by any text stating that he had been convicted under LAW once the sentence had been executed or he had been released on parole . In its reasoning it repeated the arguments which had been developed in the preliminary injunction proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal . It repeated the arguments set out in its judgment of DATE . Moreover , it referred to ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's extraordinary appeal on points of law .
